item.title: Superannuation funds accused of delaying disability insurance claims
item.description: The regulator has found that while some superannuation funds have improved insurance claims response times, others are still falling short, with long delays in relation to mental health claims.

item.title: It's hard to imagine Bondi attack won't change Australia like Port Arthur did
item.description: For a while, it was like so many other summer Sundays in Bondi, but Australia's most deadly mass shooting in almost three decades could change the country forever.

item.title: Australian share market falls, ASX Limited shares tumble on ASIC hit — as it happened
item.description: Shares in stock exchange operator ASX fell as the regulator increases its capital requirements after damning inquiry findings. The local share market started the week in the red, weighed down by heavy selling in the miners.

item.title: Cooper Connolly stars as Perth Scorchers down Sydney Sixers in BBL opener
item.description: Cooper Connolly leads the Scorchers to victory as star Sixers recruit Babar Azam struggles in the BBL curtain raiser at Perth Stadium.

item.title: ASIO examined Bondi Beach gunman Naveed Akram in 2019 for close ties to Islamic State cell
item.description: Australia's domestic intelligence agency, ASIO, examined one of the Bondi Beach gunmen six years ago for his close ties to a Sydney-based Islamic State terrorism cell, the ABC understands.

item.title: Celine Cremer search party given hope by mobile phone find, as they wait for improved weather conditions
item.description: One of the key searchers involved in the renewed hunt for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer has told of the emotion and excitement when her mobile phone was found, two and a half years after she disappeared in Tasmania.

item.title: Kendrick Lamar delights young fan with birthday song at Canberra Spilt Milk festival
item.description: American rap superstar Kendrick Lamar brought the house down at Spilt Milk in Canberra, but it was his interaction with a nine-year-old superfan that stole the show.

item.title: England warned Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks ahead of third Ashes Test
item.description: With England pinning its hopes on victory in the third Test, the tourists have been warned that the Adelaide pitch is not as friendly as it looks.

item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong, Death Stranding 2 and Donkey Kong Bananza among our best games of 2025
item.description: There are games to suit everyone, and overwhelmingly Australians are a game-playing nation. Here are some of the most important titles released this year.

item.title: Sussan Ley accuses Albanese of failing to keep Jewish Australians safe
item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley says Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has allowed antisemitism to "fester" and failed to keep Jewish Australians safe in the wake of yesterday's "evil" terror attack on the shores of Bondi.

item.title: WA's wettest towns have had no local drinking water for 15 years
item.description: Quinninup and Northcliffe in Western Australia's south-west receive an average of 1 metre of rain every year, so why has the state government spent millions of dollars trucking in drinking water?

item.title: Matildas star Sam Kerr impresses again for Chelsea in WSL after starting as sub
item.description: Matildas gun Sam Kerr starts on the bench again, but makes an immediate impact for Chelsea in a 3-0 WSL victory.

item.title: Kahu's been woodchopping his whole life, but a heart attack mid-competition almost killed him
item.description: Kahu Woolley was clinically dead multiple times, but quick actions by his friends brought him back.

item.title: Anthony Albanese will face questions over Bondi Beach shooting as Australia mourns
item.description: Anthony Albanese's first responsibility after the horrific Bondi terror attack is to lead a grieving nation. His next will be to explain how this happened.

item.title: What videos tell us about the final moments of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack
item.description: In the final horrific minutes of the Bondi Beach terror attack, more than 100 shots were fired. ABC NEWS Verify has analysed footage showing how the last six minutes unfolded.

item.title: Inquest to probe death of Allan John Houston at Saraji mine in 2018
item.description: The veteran miner died when the bulldozer he was operating rolled off an embankment into a pool of mud.

item.title: Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai found guilty of sedition and collusion
item.description: Jimmy Lai, a former Hong Kong media mogul and one of the city's most outspoken critics of China, has been found guilty of sedition and collusion in a landmark national security case that has drawn international scrutiny.

item.title: Deaths of Rob Reiner and wife investigated as apparent homicide, LAPD says
item.description: Rob Reiner, known for directing When Harry Met Sally... and A Few Good Men, was found dead alongside his wife inside their Los Angeles home.

item.title: National cabinet agrees unanimously to strengthen Australia's strict gun laws in wake of Bondi terror attack
item.description: An urgent meeting of national cabinet agrees to strengthen Australia's gun laws in the wake of the Bondi Beach shooting.

item.title: NSW inquest told how exploding lithium-ion batteries caused volatile fires killing three
item.description: A NSW inquest has been told exploding lithium-ion batteries caused volatile fires killing three people in separate blazes within minutes.

item.title: Bondi shootings show Australia's gun laws slipping since Port Arthur reforms, advocate says
item.description: Gun control advocates say the terrifying mass shooting in Bondi on Sunday shows Australia's firearms laws, reformed after the Port Arthur tragedy, have been weakened in the years since.

item.title: Consolidated Pastoral Company buys Beetaloo aggregation in historic deal worth more than $300m
item.description: Consolidated Pastoral Company spends more than $300 million to buy the Beetaloo aggregation of stations in the NT.

item.title: Harry Brook will rein in batting technique as England confirm team change for Adelaide Test
item.description: As England reveal their changes for the Adelaide Test, Harry Brook has conceded he will rein in his batting technique in an effort to save the Ashes.

item.description: Israeli politicians have blamed Anthony Albanese for the devastating massacre in Bondi.

item.title: New Queensland hospital bed timeline reveals some pushed back to 2032

item.title: CAR T-cell cancer therapy to be available in SA from mid-2026
item.description: The number of critical patients having to travel interstate to receive CAR T-cell therapy will be reduced from mid-next year, with SA to launch a service at the Royal Adelaide Hospital.

item.title: ASX bosses committed to reform after damning inquiry into stock exchange operator sees shares fall
item.description: ASX bosses say they are committed to reform after the corporate regulator lashes the operator's failings in a report, saying it underestimates long-term problems, is insular and defensive with deficiencies in culture and leadership.

item.title: Nathan Lyon insists he has nothing to prove in Adelaide ahead of Test return
item.description: For the first time in an age Nathan Lyon is not an automatic selection in the Test side but the returning off spinner insists he has nothing to prove ahead of the upcoming clash with England in Adelaide.

item.title: Largest Western Power outage in 15 years cuts essential mobile phone services in firegrounds
item.description: Firefighters are left without communications while battling emergency-level bushfires as an extended power outage sees mobile phone towers fail.

item.description: This is what psychologists have to say about approaching the subject with children.

item.title: McLeod's Daughters star Rachael Carpani dies aged 45
item.description: Rachael Carpani had recently appeared on long-running Australian soap Home and Away and frequently spoke out on a range of issues, including the need to address domestic violence.

item.title: After being run over by a car while sunbaking, Sam reunites with paramedics who saved her
item.description: Melbourne woman Samantha Hind was sunbaking on her lawn when her husband ran over her. After recovering from the brink of death, she is reunited with the paramedics who saved her life.

item.title: Tasmanian parliament passes new sentencing laws, leading to stronger punishments for hate crimes
item.description: The Tasmanian government's new laws to protect people from targeted violence have sailed through the state's parliament, with experts celebrating their "innovative" approach. But some say the job is not done yet, with work still needed to implement them successfully.

item.description: Her books like Pride and Prejudice and Emma were written hundreds of years ago, but have themes that still resonate in today's society.

item.title: What Australia can learn from the great Kiwi interest rate hike experiment
item.description: The RBA's interest rate-cutting cycle is at an end, and now a hardcore handful of critics say they shouldn't have cut rates in the first place. Conveniently, you only need to look across the ditch to see what could've happened if we'd followed that path.

item.title: Bondi attack caused by 'cascading hate' left unchecked, say critics urging antisemitism plan be adopted
item.description: A report that has sat on Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's desk for months is being raised by critics as key evidence that the federal government has done too little, too late to respond to the rising tide of antisemitism since the October 7 terror attack in Israel.

item.title: Magic mushroom warning as Nimbin farmer fed up with trespassing foragers
item.description: A farmer is concerned for the safety of people foraging for magic mushrooms, which he has sprayed with herbicide, as a toxicologist warns about the dangers of fungi.

item.description: With only nine more sleeps until Christmas, we have now entered the meteorological window of predictability — in other words, forecasts are more accurate than just guessing the weather.

item.description: The ASX slipped into the red after a positive start to the session, dragged down by energy stocks, miners and the banks

item.description: Richmond takes Olivia Wolmarans with the top pick in the AFLW draft, as the Suns complete a stunning raid.

item.description: Aspiring Darwin filmmakers with disabilities have been getting job-ready, developing skills in scriptwriting, directing, cinematography and editing. It is the first time the program has been offered in the NT, with plans for it to expand even further.

item.description: The ACT government is considering how to better manage the territory's wombat population, in response to challenges being experienced by farmers.

item.description: Storms and heavy rain are forecast to again hit large parts of Queensland today, with temperatures dropping across much of the sunshine state.

item.description: Twenty-five London plane trees are set to be removed from Hamilton after they were found to be causing problems with local infrastructure.

item.description: A NSW cricketer, who has played at Sheffield Shield level, is banned from playing after allegations he sent nude photos to young teammates.

item.description: Umpires in the Big Bash clash between the Renegades and Heat sensationally pull Shaheen Afridi out of the attack after two full-toss deliveries.

item.description: The second police officer injured in Sunday's terrorist attack at Bondi Beach has been identified as 22-year-old Probationary Constable Jack Hibbert.

item.title: Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed a 'source of pride' for family and friends in Syria
item.description: The village of Al Nayrab, in north-west Syria, is the hometown of Bondi hero Ahmed Al Ahmed — and its residents are filled with pride.

item.title: NSW parliament recalled to discuss gun reforms after Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: Premier Chris Minns said among the reforms to be discussed were proposed limits on the number of firearms a licensed shooter could own.

item.title: Falling tree kills farmer tackling blaze in Mindarabin, in WA's Great Southern
item.description: A 34-year-old farmer dies helping fight a fire in Mindarabin, in WA's Great Southern region.

item.title: Former Beauty and the Geek contestant's murder case adjourned as SA court awaits more evidence
item.description: Police are still waiting to examine a large volume of evidence, including a a post-mortem report in the "complex" alleged murder case involving Tamika Chesser, a court has heard.

item.title: Shakira Adams gets maximum time behind bars for crash that killed Matthew McLuckie
item.description: Shakira Adams had no licence and methamphetamine in her system when she drove a stolen car at least 177 kilometres per hour into Matthew McLuckie's car.

item.title: Rays and sharks washed up on Kangaroo Island linked to algal bloom
item.description: Dead rays and sharks found along a regional South Australia beach have been linked to the algal bloom, the government confirms.

item.title: Former AFL footballer Marlion Pickett handed suspended prison term
item.description: Dual Richmond premiership player Marlion Pickett receives a suspended prison term for possessing and dealing with proceeds of crime, in what a judge calls a "line-ball decision".

item.title: Police lay murder charge against 47-year-old man, three years after woman's death in Katherine
item.description: Police have charged a 47-year-old man with murder three years after the death of a woman who was found unconscious on a street corner in Katherine.

item.title: Frydenberg calls for antisemitism royal commission after Bondi attack
item.description: Former treasurer Josh Frydenberg has called for bans on radical "hate preachers," protests, stronger immigration laws and a royal commission into antisemitism in an emotional speech at the site of the Bondi terror attack.

item.title: Bondi shooter Naveed Akram charged by NSW Police over terrorist attack
item.description: Naveed Akram has been charged over the terrorist attack that killed 15 people at Bondi Beach.

item.title: North Queensland's small Jewish community celebrates Hanukkah in Townsville
item.description: North Queensland's only rabbi did not let a nine-hour traffic delay stop him from spreading light during Hanukkah to a Jewish community grappling with the Bondi tragedy.

item.title: High school graduate Annabelle Klint-Pedersen weeks away from moving overseas before fatal fall
item.description: Annabelle Klint-Pedersen was celebrating the end of year 12 with friends on the Sunshine Coast when an innocent trip to watch the sunset went tragically wrong.

item.title: Australians are rushed and time-poor with most working unpaid hours
item.description: Most people spent time doing unpaid work in 2024, according to new data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics. It found women spent on average an hour more doing unpaid work than men.

item.title: Queensland records worst flu season in a decade, with cases 18 per cent up on last year
item.description: Official data shows more than 90,000 lab-confirmed cases of influenza in 2025, which is more than an 18 per cent jump on the number of cases reported last year.

item.title: Tom McLuckie outside court after Shakira Adams is sentenced over his son Matthew's death
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Noosa Council blames 'human error' for $2.3 million AI scam
item.description: The Noosa Council is now blaming human error for a major fraud incident that cost ratepayers millions of dollars — while not acknowledging earlier supplier scam warnings.

item.title: Loved ones seek support to repatriate minivan crash victims to Papua New Guinea
item.description: A teenage boy and a 51-year-old woman from Papua New Guinea have been identified as victims of a fatal crash in Northern Victoria.

item.title: Day-night Tests locked in for Australian summer until 2031
item.description: Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg opens up on the future of day-night Tests in the future summer schedule.

item.title: Ashes drama for Steve Smith, Alex Carey and DRS — quick hits from day one of the third Test at Adelaide Oval
item.description: Australia's first-innings topscorers get some help from England's sloppy fielders and the DRS technology on a tightly contested day in Adelaide. Here are the quick hits from day one of the third Ashes Test.

item.title: Teenager jailed after stabbing doctor at Tasmanian hospital in 2023
item.description: A doctor went through a "lengthy, risky and complicated" surgery and continues to experience nightmares and flashbacks after being stabbed by a teenager he was treating in 2023, a court is told.

item.title: Tim Tszyu dominates Anthony Velazquez, wins on boxing return in Sydney
item.description: Tim Tszyu has dominated against unbeaten American Anthony Velazquez, winning by unanimous decision at the Sydney Entertainment Centre.

item.title: Alex Carey's maiden Ashes ton rescues Australia, delights Adelaide and elevates his status
item.description: Alex Carey looked to the heavens as his name rang out from the Adelaide Oval stands, his emotional century saving Australia's day one and furthering his push to one day stand among the great wicketkeeper-bats.

item.title: Cyril Mark Yeeda faces court over alleged $170k sale of alcohol in WA dry communities
item.description: Police allege Cyril Mark Yeeda sold $45,000 worth of alcohol in dry communities for $170,000.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Man refused bail charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on boat
item.description: Lake Macquarie man Jake Dearie has been refused bail after being charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on his boat.

item.title: ACT inquiry slams 'aggressive' debt recovery in stamp duty concession scheme
item.description: A legislative inquiry has criticised the ACT government for aggressively recovering debts from people it found were ineligible for stamp duty concessions.

item.title: Bondi Beach gunmen's movements in Philippines under investigation by local police
item.description: Philippines National Police say they are investigating whether the father-son Bondi gunmen travelled to a region known as a hotbed for violent Islamist militants.

item.title: UK's Duke of Marlborough charged with intentional strangulation
item.description: Charles James Spencer-Churchill, 70, who is known as Jamie Blandford, is the 12th Duke of Marlborough, one of Britain's most senior aristocratic families.

item.title: Warner Bros Discovery board rejects rival $163bn bid from Paramount
item.description: In a letter to shareholders, the board wrote that Paramount had "consistently misled" Warner Bros shareholders that its $US30-per-share cash offer was fully guaranteed, or "backstopped," by the Ellison family,

item.title: Labor faces green 'Grinch' hospital funding accusations with a budget in the red
item.description: Labor has two options when it comes to straddling a budget in the red and accusations it has become a green Grinch on health funding.

item.title: How Tom Silvagni kept his name out of headlines before his rape conviction
item.description: Silvagni employed a legal team exclusively to fight for a suppression order, preventing his name from being reported by the media for more than a year.

item.title: How well do you know 2025 arts award winners?
item.description: The 2026 Oscars are just around the corner but let's give this year's arts award winners just a couple more moments in the sun.

item.title: Today in History, December 18: The lessons from Donald Trump's first impeachment trial
item.description: When Trump was elected president in 2016, he joined the world's most exclusive and revered club. But three years later, the president added his name to a smaller list of US leaders who'd been impeached.

item.title: After leading JackJumpers to NBL glory, club boss Finnegan says time is right for her to move on
item.description: After almost 20 years working in men's sport, Christine Finnegan says the time is right for her to leave the NBL club she lead to championship glory, and move into a solely women's sport role.

item.title: Pregnant mum who shielded stranger's daughter in Bondi terror attack says she is 'not a hero'
item.description: When Jessica Rozen saw a little girl crying as gunshots rang out, instinct kicked in.

item.title: AI-generated images of Bondi gunman used to spread false information
item.description: AI-generated images of Bondi gunman Naveed Akram in the Philippines and a fabricated Facebook page are spreading online. And an image of police officers taken out of context is debunked by ABC NEWS Verify.

item.title: The election is over, but inflation is still dominating the economic story
item.description: Jim Chalmers has started his second term as treasurer just like the first one ended: trying to frame the budget on his terms, but with one eye on inflation.

item.title: Government issues warning as mandatory registration for some NDIS providers confirmed
item.description: The government confirms two categories of NDIS providers will be subject to mandatory registration, more than a year after it was handed recommendations for how to implement a new system.

item.title: Why Trump's low-profile chief of staff Susie Wiles is making headlines
item.description: The long-time political operator is unusually candid during a series of interviews with magazine Vanity Fair.

item.title: England fume as Snicko operator admits error in Alex Carey reprieve in third Ashes Test
item.description: Snicko's boss admits an operator error dudded England out of the wicket of Alex Carey on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Harold Larwood interviewed by Tim Bowden and Norman May on the origins of Bodyline
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Bodyline bowler Harold Larwood pummeled Australia — but was pipped by pomegranates
item.description: Flying fruit pips are less menacing than the cork and leather cricket balls that Harold Larwood hurled at Australian batsmen during the infamous Bodyline series, but a showdown between the English fast bowler and a disgruntled crowd that was allegedly armed with pomegranate seeds is part of the rich story of Ashes acrimony.

item.title: Construction Skills Queensland warns that workforce shortages could 'escalate costs' ahead of Brisbane 2032
item.description: The Queensland auditor-general says there will be a higher risk of delays and cost escalations for infrastructure projects ahead of the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games due to shortages in key trade occupations.

item.title: Prostate cancer survivor with incontinence speaks out about lack of men's sanitary bins
item.description: Prostate cancer survivor Mick Barrett is calling on businesses to consider installing rubbish bins inside men's bathrooms to help those with incontinence.

item.title: Don't rush to change gun laws after Bondi, farmers and shooters group in Tasmania says
item.description: As state and territory leaders consider tougher gun laws, the Tasmanian government is under pressure from interest groups and advocates on all sides of the debate.

item.title: Suspicious house fire at Clyde North leaves one man critically injured and others in hospital
item.description: Police are investigating the cause of a house fire which has left one man fighting for life in hospital and several other people injured.

item.title: Outback town has 'zero' rental stock as new copper mine is set to increase housing pressure
item.description: When Leylanie moved her family back to her home town a year ago, she did not expect to be spending this Christmas still living out of a motel.

item.title: Victoria's gold boom continues as two big exploration tunnels approved
item.description: The Victorian government approves two companies to drill deep underground exploration tunnels amid a gold "renaissance" driven by high gold prices.

item.title: Bondi Beach shooting live updates: 10yo attack victim Matilda to be farewelled at Sydney funeral
item.description: Ten-year-old Matilda, the youngest of the Bondi shooting victims, will be farewelled today at a funeral service in Sydney's eastern suburbs. Follow live.

item.title: Gun control debate heats up over proposed NSW firearm cap in wake of Bondi Beach shooting
item.description: Firearm restrictions proposed by the New South Wales government in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack would go far to reduce the growing number of guns across the state and prevent further harm, a gun control researcher says.

item.title: Annitta Macauley at Lifeview in Melbourne budgets for live entertainment, something ventriloquist Natalie May argues, provides a human touch.

item.title: Aged care centres urged to budget for live entertainment to provide human connection
item.description: A performer and an advocate for older Australians are worried that live entertainment for aged care residents is on the decline as other leisure activities, such as virtual reality, gain popularity.

item.title: Live updates: More than $100m compensation to be paid to First Guardian investors
item.description: Netwealth will pay out more than $100 million to First Guardian investors after it struck a deal with the corporate watchdog. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: Linton Harris, SES volunteer, speaks about the search for Celine Cremer
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Celine Cremer searchers 'take a breath', as they wait for forensic tests on phone, plastic bag and bottle
item.description: After new breakthroughs in the search for missing tourist Celine Cremer in the dense Tasmanian bush, the wait begins for the results of forensic tests on items discovered in the forest.

item.title: Oscars to stream exclusively on YouTube from 2029, academy says
item.description: In a seismic shift for one of television's marquee events, the Academy Awards will depart US broadcaster ABC and begin streaming on YouTube, beginning in 2029.

item.title: Proposed highway to alleviate AUKUS traffic congestion scrapped after feasibility study
item.description: A proposal for a new highway in Perth's south to help alleviate traffic issues ahead of an influx of AUKUS sailors is scrapped after a study finds it is not needed.

item.title: Adelaide Strikers down Sydney Sixers in BBL as Daniel Hughes makes sensational catch
item.description: The Strikers consign the Sixers to 0-2 despite Daniel Hughes taking a one-handed ripper late in the match.

item.title: Leroy Johnson talks and sings about his travels through the far west.

item.title: Broken Hill arts community left in the lurch following funding cuts
item.description: Malyangapa Baaka Wiimpatja artist Leroy Johnson says the axing of an arts grant, which he is the last recipient of, has left the Broken Hill arts community feeling unsupported.

item.title: Caravan park residents in Tasmania to get increased protections under proposed legislation
item.description: Long-term residents of Tasmanian caravan parks would be protected from unlimited rent increases and no-grounds evictions and be able to sell their homes under draft legislation.

item.title: Nick Reiner appears in court charged over the stabbing murder of his parents
item.description: Nick Reiner briefly fronts court three days after he was arrested over the stabbing murders of his Hollywood director father, Rob Reiner, and mother, Michele Singer Reiner.

item.title: Outback Farm stars finish first barley harvest at Central Australian farm
item.description: Amidst the red dirt, termite mounds and buffel grass, the first barley harvest is finished at Central Australia's Athelle Outback Hideaway.

item.title: Crime in Victoria continues to rise, driven by an increase in thefts and a rise in family violence
item.description: The latest statistics show crime in Victoria is at its highest level since the Crime Statistics Agency started keeping records 20 years ago.
